required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: This Study Will Describe the Burden of DENgue Fever Virus (DENV) Illness Among Household Members Aged 6 Months to 50 Years of Selected Communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia
clinical_study.official_title: A Cohort Study to Assess the Burden of Dengue Illness in Household Members From Selected Communities in Southeast Asia and Latin America

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe the burden of DENV illness among household members aged 6 months to 50 years of selected communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Percentage of Reverse Transcriptase Quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection During the Study Period by Study Site
primary_outcome.description: Incidence percentage of RT-qPCR confirmed symptomatic dengue infection was expressed as percentage of subjects = (n [number of subjects with at least one event reported during the study period ]/N [number of subjects in the population]) X 100. The 95% Wald CI was calculated. Clustering effect was not retained because equal or less than 1. RT-qPCR confirmed symptomatic case = suspected dengue case (SDC) confirmed by RT-qPCR. See SDC definition in outcome 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With DENV-type Specific Confirmed Symptomatic DENV Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Dengue Virus (DENV)-Type 1, 2 3 or 4 Ribonucleid acid would have been considered for this analysis but it was not performed due to the low number of cases reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Proportion of Virologically Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection During the Study Period in Mexico
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence proportion of virologically confirmed symptomatic dengue infection was estimated from GEE logistic regression model taking the clustering effect into account. The 95% confidence interval was based on the robust variance estimate from the GEE model. Clusters were households for analysis by study site. Virologically confirmed symptomatic case = suspected dengue case (SDC) confirmed by RT-qPCR or non-structural protein 1 (NS1). See SDC definition in outcome 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Percentage of Virologically Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection During the Study Period in the Philippines.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence percentage of virologically confirmed symptomatic dengue infection was expressed as percentage of subjects = (n [number of subjects with at least one event reported during the study period]/N [number of subjects in the population]) X 100. The 95% Wald CI was calculated. Clustering effect was not retained because equal or less than 1. RT-qPCR confirmed symptomatic case = suspected dengue case (SDC) confirmed by RT-qPCR. See SDC definition in outcome 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Proportion of Probable Symptomatic Dengue Infection During the Study Period.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence proportion of probable confirmed symptomatic dengue infection was estimated from GEE model with clustering effect. Clusters were households for analysis by study site and study sites for analysis on overall study sites. A probable confirmed dengue infection is an SDC with DENV RT-qPCR negative or not performed (late presenter), and DENV NS1 negative or undetermined (early or late presenter), and Anti-DENV Immunoglobulin type M (IgM) positive with a rapid immunochromatographic (ICT) assay or an Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) assay, or Anti-DENV IgG positive (rapid ICT assay or 'capture ELISA' assay). SDC defined as acute febrile illness measured as greater or equal to 38.0°C or recent history of febrile illness (onset in the past 8 days) reported for at least 2 consecutive days (duration of approximately 36-48 hours) and < 7 days duration, which might be accompanied by other dengue symptoms or signs with no defined focus or obvious reason unrelated to dengue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With Dengue Virus Antibody IgG Positive Result (ELISA) at First Visit (Indicative of Past DENV Infection), by Study Site and Age Category.
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with Dengue Virus antibody IgG positive result (ELISA) was estimated from GEE model with clustering effect. The 95% CI was based on the robust variance estimate from the GEE model. Clusters were households for analysis by study site. Ages categories were defined as follows: "6 months -<12 Months" = from the 6 Months birthday up to and including the day before the 1st year birthday, and the next "n-p Years" categories = from the nth Year birthday up to and including the day before the (p+1)th Year birthday. Analysis was not summarized for confirmed and probable dengue cases, separately, as there were no probable cases reported in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Dengue Virus Antibody IgG Positive Result (ELISA) at First Visit (Indicative of Past DENV Infection), by Study Site and Age Category.
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with Dengue Virus antibody IgG positive result (ELISA) was expressed as percentage of subjects = (n [number of subjects with at least one event reported during the study period]/N [number of subjects in the population]) X 100. The 95% Wald CI was calculated. Clustering effect was not retained because equal or less than 1. Ages categories were defined as follows: "6 months -<12 Months" = from the 6 Months birthday up to and including the day before the 1st year birthday, and the next "n-p Years" categories = from the nth Year birthday up to and including the day before the (p+1)th Year birthday. Analysis was not summarized for confirmed and probable dengue cases, separately as there were no probable cases reported in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Suspected Dengue Cases With Temperature and Any Symptom From First and Returned Visits
secondary_outcome.description: The following characteristics were summarized for each category of dengue cases (Virologically confirmed, probable, other SDC): Temperature at first visit: <37.5, ≥37.5, >38, >38.5, >39 °C and Clinical symptoms at onset, from first and returned visits. The results are presented for the virologically confirmed cases (VDC) and the other SDC (oSDC), no probable cases being reported in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Suspected Dengue Cases With Severity Criteria Characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical classification of the suspected dengue cases were distributed among following categories: Subject hospitalized during suspected dengue episode; OR At least 1 WHO 2009 warning signs: i.e. Abdominal pain or tenderness, Persistent vomiting, Clinical fluid accumulation, Mucosal bleed, Liver enlargement, Increase in HCT concurrent with rapid decrease in platelet count, Lethargy and restlessness; OR At least 1 WHO 2009 criteria for severe dengue: i.e. Severe Plasma Leakage leading to Shock, Fluid accumulation with respiratory distress, Severe Bleeding, Severe organ involvement; Liver: Aspartate transaminase or Alanine transferase ≥ 1000 International Unit/Liter, Central nervous system: impaired consciousness, Failure of heart and other organs; OR Most likely diagnosis for an episode of defined illnesses [investigator opinion]. The following characteristics were summarized for Virologically confirmed cases (VDC) and other SDC (oSDC), no probable cases being reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Related to a Study Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject..

arm_group.description: Subjects aged between 6 months and 50 years at the time of enrolment living in geographically-defined communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia. The study population comprised household members and should include between 30% and 50% of adults (aged 18 years or above) per site.The appropriate recruitment strategy was selected by each participating site. Two approaches might be considered: a school-based approach and a community-based approach without school involvement The expected period for recruiting the target sample size was approximately three months.

intervention.description: All participants will have an enrolment visit with collection of a blood sample and a termination contact/visit. Participants or their parents/guardians will be contacted weekly or every two weeks to monitor the occurrence of febrile episodes. Additional visits will be made if febrile episodes occur. In case of dengue suspicion, a blood sample will be collected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written and signed informed consent (and assent if the subject is below the legal age of consent) obtained from the subject/from subject's parent(s)/LAR(s). For a subject below the legal age of consent is, his/her signature will be obtained on the informed assent form, if applicable.
- A male or female between, and including 6 months and 50 years of age at the time of enrolment (Subjects become ineligible on their 51st birthday).
- Subject and/or the subject's parent(s)/LAR(s) who the investigator believes can comply with the requirements of the protocol (e.g., willingness to go to the hospital/healthcare centre for visit(s) in case of acute febrile illness, able to observe the signs of dengue and to understand how to take and report body temperature, etc).
- Subject who plans, at the time of enrolment, to remain at same residence/study area during the one or two year study period (as applicable).
- Household should be reachable by phone (residence phone or mobile phone). Note: Pregnant or lactating female or female planning to become pregnant can be recruited into the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child in care.
- Participation (current or planned) in another epidemiological study or in a clinical trial that would conflict with the current study, based on investigator's judgement.
- Terminal illness or severe mental incapacity.

overall_official.affiliation: GlaxoSmithKline (for GlaxoSmithKline; Human Genome Sciences Inc., a GSK Company; Sirtris, a GSK Company; Stiefel, a GSK Company; ViiV Healthcare)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: In December 2017, GSK decided to deprioritize the development of the dengue purified inactivated vaccine (DPIV) candidate. This decision was made due to the significant scientific challenges of dengue vaccine development. Hence, only 2 sites participated to the study, 1 in Mexico and 1 in Philippines.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 6 months and 50 years at the time of enrolment living in geographically-defined communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia. The study population comprised household members and should include between 30% and 50% of adults (aged 18 years or above) per site.The appropriate recruitment strategy was selected by each participating site. Two approaches were considered: a school-based approach and a community-based approach without school involvement The expected period for recruiting the target sample size was approximately three months.

group.description: Subjects aged between 6 months and 50 years at the time of enrolment living in geographically-defined communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia. Two approaches were considered: a school-based approach and a community-based approach without school involvement The expected period for recruiting the target sample size was approximately three months.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Incidence Percentage of Reverse Transcriptase Quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-qPCR) Confirmed Symptomatic Dengue Infection During the Study Period by Study Site
outcome.description: Incidence percentage of RT-qPCR confirmed symptomatic dengue infection was expressed as percentage of subjects = (n [number of subjects with at least one event reported during the study period ]/N [number of subjects in the population]) X 100. The 95% Wald CI was calculated. Clustering effect was not retained because equal or less than 1. RT-qPCR confirmed symptomatic case = suspected dengue case (SDC) confirmed by RT-qPCR. See SDC definition in outcome 5.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort that included all evaluable subjects, i.e. subjects who met all eligibility criteria, complying with the procedures defined in the protocol and for whom data of at least one follow-up contact were available.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With Dengue Virus Antibody IgG Positive Result (ELISA) at First Visit (Indicative of Past DENV Infection), by Study Site and Age Category.
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with Dengue Virus antibody IgG positive result (ELISA) was expressed as percentage of subjects = (n [number of subjects with at least one event reported during the study period]/N [number of subjects in the population]) X 100. The 95% Wald CI was calculated. Clustering effect was not retained because equal or less than 1. Ages categories were defined as follows: "6 months -<12 Months" = from the 6 Months birthday up to and including the day before the 1st year birthday, and the next "n-p Years" categories = from the nth Year birthday up to and including the day before the (p+1)th Year birthday. Analysis was not summarized for confirmed and probable dengue cases, separately as there were no probable cases reported in the study.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort that included all evaluable subjects from Mexico (1-4 years age) and the Philippines (6-12 months), i.e. subjects who met all eligibility criteria, complying with the procedures defined in the protocol and for whom data of at least one follow-up contact were available.

outcome.title: Number of Suspected Dengue Cases With Severity Criteria Characteristics
outcome.description: The clinical classification of the suspected dengue cases were distributed among following categories: Subject hospitalized during suspected dengue episode; OR At least 1 WHO 2009 warning signs: i.e. Abdominal pain or tenderness, Persistent vomiting, Clinical fluid accumulation, Mucosal bleed, Liver enlargement, Increase in HCT concurrent with rapid decrease in platelet count, Lethargy and restlessness; OR At least 1 WHO 2009 criteria for severe dengue: i.e. Severe Plasma Leakage leading to Shock, Fluid accumulation with respiratory distress, Severe Bleeding, Severe organ involvement; Liver: Aspartate transaminase or Alanine transferase ≥ 1000 International Unit/Liter, Central nervous system: impaired consciousness, Failure of heart and other organs; OR Most likely diagnosis for an episode of defined illnesses [investigator opinion]. The following characteristics were summarized for Virologically confirmed cases (VDC) and other SDC (oSDC), no probable cases being reported.

class.title: At least 1 WHO 2009 warning signs VDC
At least 1 WHO 2009 severe dengue criteria VDC
Most likely diagnosis: Rota/enteric infection VDC
Most likely diagnosis: other infection disease VDC
Most likely diagnosis: non-infectious disease VDC
At least 1 WHO 2009 warning signs oSDC
At least 1 WHO 2009 severe dengue criteria oSDC
Most likely diagnosis: Rota/enteric infection oSDC
Most likely diagnosis: other infection oSDC
Most likely diagnosis: non-infectious disease oSDC

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Related to a Study Procedure
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject..
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total cohort that included all subjects enrolled in the study.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 6 months and 50 years at the time of enrolment living in geographically-defined communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia. The study population comprised household members and should include between 30% and 50% of adults (aged 18 years or above) per site.The appropriate recruitment strategy was selected by each participating site. Two approaches were considered: a school-based approach and a community-based approach without school involvement The expected period for recruiting the target sample size was approximately three months.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Related to a Study Procedure
measure.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject..
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total cohort that included all subjects enrolled in the study.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious adverse events were collected from Day 0 to Month 24 (study end).
reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events were not collected in this study.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 6 months and 50 years at the time of enrolment living in geographically-defined communities in Latin America and Southeast Asia. The study population comprised household members and should include between 30% and 50% of adults (aged 18 years or above) per site.The appropriate recruitment strategy was selected by each participating site. Two approaches were considered: a school-based approach and a community-based approach without school involvement The expected period for recruiting the target sample size was approximately three months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Analyses by season/year, age, gender, serotype and dengue serological status at beginning of analysis period were not performed due to low number of virologically confirmed or probable symptomatic dengue infection reported during the study period.
